DOC.brief_title: Combination Medications vs. Patch Alone Medically-Ill Smokers
DOC.detailed_description: Subjects randomly receive either nicotine patch alone 10-week , taper course ( n=64 ) combination nicotine patch , nicotine oral inhaler , bupropion ad-lib duration ( n=63 ) .
DOC.criteria: currently smoke least 10 cigarette per day ( confirm high exhale carbonmonoxide ( CO ) ) 18 year older interested quit within next 30 day one predefined medical illness ( include cardiovascular disease , vascular disease , chronic pulmonary disease , cancer , hypertension , diabetes , hyperlipidemia , recurrent pulmonary infection ) contraindication pharmacotherapy ( include unstable angina , myocardial infarction within 2 month , severe arrhythmia , seizure disorder , serious mental illness require antipsychotic medication ) current use tobacco product ( smokeless tobacco , cigar , pipe , etc . ) , bupropion , clonidine , nortriptyline , nicotine replacement medication unable give consent
